oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Officers of C.C.C. Camp No. 496
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two unidentified officers of C.C.C. Camp No. 496 standing in front of headquarters.

Capt. Hoke S. O'Kelly was commanding officier of C.C.C. Camp 496 which was created to combat soil erosion and located in Lexington, TN. The Civilian Conservation Corps facilitated the spread of kudzu by; planting millions of seedlings as part of an extensive soil erosion project.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
Conservation of natural resources; Soil conservation
